bug.author: MauGal
bug.summary: Problem in sidebar: checkbox lose their status
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
In sidebar there are 3 checkbox. First checkbox, when clicked (from false to true), views in sidebar under it a selectbox. The other 2 checkbox lose thier state (if they are true, they go to false) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The 2 checkbox under selectbox must maintain the state they are in <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The 2 checkbox under selectbox lose thier state <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
I don't know <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.54.0 Python version: 3.7.3 No conda, no virtual env OS version: Windows 10 Pro (1903) Browser version: Chrome (79.0.3945.130)

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MauGal>@MauGal</denchmark-link> Thanks for sharing this, could you send a toy example showing this behavior ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/arraydude>@arraydude</denchmark-link>
For example: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st
if st.sidebar.checkbox('Show selectbox'): value_selected = st.sidebar.selectbox('choose an option',options=['one','two','three']) if st.sidebar.checkbox('Show message'): st.write('## This is the first message') value_checkbox = st.sidebar.checkbox('Show other message') if value_checkbox: st.write('## This is second message') </denchmark-code>
check the second checkbox: the message is displayed
then check the first checkbox the selectbox is displayed The status of second checkbox change (from true to false) but the message on right there is still
I think that the status of second checkbox must not change
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MauGal>@MauGal</denchmark-link> -- I can indeed reproduce this effect and agree it is some kind of bug. Thanks!

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link> , I have an issue where the checkbox always defaults to True. I am not sure if this is the same issue or a different one. If you want I can open up a separate issue, otherwise happy to talk about it here. marine_matrix = st.sidebar.checkbox(label="Run Full Marine Matrix", value="False") <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33131958/74761338-b7931900-5230-11ea-8eed-f7323ff6d9c7.png></denchmark-link>
This repros up to 0.56. It is fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1102>#1102</denchmark-link>

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/monchier>@monchier</denchmark-link> , I don't think this is fixed. My checkbox still defaults to True, even if I put False. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33131958/76239014-07408100-61ee-11ea-8bd3-9ff2d6270556.png></denchmark-link>

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kurt-rhee>@kurt-rhee</denchmark-link> , I just tried and I wasn't able to reproduce the bug using the code posted by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MauGal>@MauGal</denchmark-link> , which is probably why <denchmark-link:https://github.com/monchier>@monchier</denchmark-link> closed the bug. Could you open a new bug and make sure it contains the entire script that helps us see what you're seeing? Thanks -- apologies for the inconvenience.
